snippet: The man, who was still handcuffed, fled from the back of a police vehicle and ran into a subway station, prompting the authorities to temporarily halt train service as they searched for him.
abstract: New York City officials announce suspect in police custody escaped from back of police vehicle and ran into subway station in Lower Manhattan; escaping suspects has been recurring issue for city's Police Dept, and have drawn sharp criticism from Police Commissioner William J Bratton, including disciplinary action against officers.
lead_paragraph: The man, who was still handcuffed, fled from the back of a police vehicle and ran into a subway station, prompting the authorities to temporarily halt train service as they searched for him.

headline.main: Suspect Escapes From Police Custody in Lower Manhattan
